title: Open source content management for your Git workflow
subtitle: Use Static CMS with any static site generator for a faster and more flexible web project

overviews.title: Static + content management = ♥
overviews.description: Get the speed, security, and scalability of a static site, while still providing a convenient editing interface for content.

overviews.title: An integrated part of your Git workflow
overviews.description: Content is stored in your Git repository alongside your code for easier versioning and the option to handle content updates directly in Git.

overviews.title: An extensible CMS built on React
overviews.description: Static CMS is built as a single-page React app. Create custom-styled previews, UI widgets, and editor plugins or add backends to support different Git platform APIs.

call_to_action.title: Getting started is simple and free.
call_to_action.subtitle: Choose a template that's pre-configured with a static site generator and deploys to a global CDN in one click.

features_intro.title: A CMS that developers and content editors can agree on
features_intro.subtitle1: You get to implement modern front end tools to deliver a faster, safer, and more scalable site.
features_intro.subtitle2: Editors get a friendly UI and intuitive workflow that meets their content management requirements.

features.title: Editor-friendly user interface
features.description: The web-based app includes rich-text editing, real-time previews, and drag-and-drop media uploads.

features.title: Your content, your way
features.description: Static CMS can integrate with most major static site generators and git repository providers.

features.title: Instant access without GitHub account
features.description: With Git Gateway, you can add CMS access for any team member — even if they don't have a GitHub account.
